titleStmt.title: A letter from Mr. Robert Iohnston, one of the Elders at Edenborough, directed to Master VVilliam Agard in Cambridge with a petition of the English there inclosed, to the Kings most excellent Majesty. Also Master Agards letter to his friend in London, coneteyning [sic] matters of great moment, tending to the pacification of the miserable distractions of these present times.
titleStmt.author: Johnston, Robert, one of the elders of Edenborough.

titleStmt.title: A letter from Mr. Robert Iohnston, one of the Elders at Edenborough, directed to Master VVilliam Agard in Cambridge with a petition of the English there inclosed, to the Kings most excellent Majesty. Also Master Agards letter to his friend in London, coneteyning [sic] matters of great moment, tending to the pacification of the miserable distractions of these present times.
titleStmt.author: Johnston, Robert, one of the elders of Edenborough.
Agard, William.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
